clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Assess the Effect of an Intervention Integrating Contingency Management (Financial Incentives) to Enhance Hepatitis C Treatment Uptake Following Dried Blood Spot Hepatitis C RNA Testing Among People With Recent Injecting Drug Use Attending Needle and Syringe Programs
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Two-arm, Individual-level, Randomised Controlled Trial to Assess the Effect of an Intervention Integrating Contingency Management (Financial Incentives) to Enhance Hepatitis C Treatment Uptake Following Dried Blood Spot Hepatitis C RNA Testing Among People With Recent Injecting Drug Use Attending Needle and Syringe Programs

brief_summary.textblock: A pilot two-arm, individual-level, randomised controlled trial to assess the effect of an intervention integrating contingency management (financial incentives) to enhance hepatitis C treatment uptake following dried blood spot hepatitis C RNA testing among people with recent injecting drug use attending needle and syringe programs: the AMPLIFY study

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be randomised with a computerised random number generator (or random number table) with block randomisation to assist with keeping participant balance between study arms with a small sample size.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of participants who initiate Hepatitis C Virus treatment within 12 weeks of testing
primary_outcome.description: Data will be presented in percentages and mean (SD) or median values (interquartile range), as appropriate. Chi square test or Fisher's exact test will be utilised, as appropriate, to examine between group differences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of recruitment through a peer-based referral incentivization scheme
Time to visit to confirm viral cure (e.g. sustained virological response, SVR12)
Participant perceptions and acceptability of being involved in a contingency management study will be assessed by study questionnaire
Feasibility of a contingency management intervention to enhance hepatitis C treatment uptake
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who enrolled in the study and where assigned treatment who commenced treatment.

intervention.description: Incentive payment to enhance HCV treatment uptake among people with recent injecting drug use attending needle and syringe programs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participants have voluntarily signed the informed consent form
2. 18 years of age or older
3. Recent injecting drug use (previous six months)
Exclusion Criteria:
1) Inability or unwillingness to provide informed consent
